customData.content: 48-year-old male presented to the Emergency Room with a 3-day history of worsening widespread joint pain and swelling, resulting in total debility and being bedbound. Joint swelling and pain started suddenly and was generalized to all four limbs, with the left knee being particularly painful and swollen. The patient also reported anorexia, nausea, and a lack of energy for about 2 weeks.

HPI.summary: 48-year-old male presented to the Emergency Room with a 3-day history of worsening widespread joint pain and swelling, resulting in total debility and being bedbound. Joint swelling and pain started suddenly and was generalized to all four limbs, with the left knee being particularly painful and swollen. The patient also reported anorexia, nausea, and a lack of energy for about 2 weeks.

customData.content: Past surgical history of ORIF left tibia with nail placement following a traumatic tibial fracture. Social history: daily marijuana use, 1 pack per day smoker for 30 years, no alcohol or drug use, unemployed. Physical exam: BP 116/65, T 98.5 degrees Fahrenheit, RR 16, SPO2 100% on room air. Extremities: moderate dactylitis of all fingers and toes, pain to palpation of hands and feet, left knee pain with restricted movement, pain and swelling over left ankle, widespread finger clubbing.

procedures.name: Open Reduction Internal Fixation of Tibia

physical_exam.finding: moderate dactylitis of all fingers and toes
pain to palpation of hands and feet
left knee pain with restricted movement
pain and swelling over left ankle

customData.content: Microcytic anemia (new from 1 year prior). Chest X-ray: large oval mass in right upper lobe, may represent bulla or soft tissue mass. Admitted to general medical floor and worked up for arthritis (rheumatoid arthritis, seronegative spondyloarthropathy, disseminated gonococcal infection, or septic arthritis). Started on scheduled NSAIDs and oral glucocorticoids for symptomatic treatment of arthritis.

imaging.finding: large oval mass in right upper lobe, may represent bulla or soft tissue mass
imaging.impression: large oval mass in right upper lobe, may represent bulla or soft tissue mass

customData.content: Chest x-ray revealed a large lung mass. Follow-up CT scan revealed severe emphysema and a 6.5 cm x 8.7 cm x 5.8 cm mass in the right upper lobe. Comprehensive metabolic panel performed.

imaging.finding: 6.5 cm x 8.7 cm x 5.8 cm mass

customData.content: Urinalysis performed. Acute hepatitis panel: negative. HIV screen: negative. Sedimentation rate: 125 mm/HR (reference 0–15).

Labs: C-reactive protein 261 mg/L (high). Iron profile: Iron 22 mcg/dL (low), TIBC 173 mcg/dL (low), Iron Saturation 13% (low), Ferritin 1330 ng/mL (high). ANA screen: negative. Rheumatoid factor: negative.
Labs: Anti-CCP antibodies: negative. Gonorrhea and chlamydia PCR: negative. HLA B-27: negative. Parvovirus: IgG positive, IgM negative.
Labs: ANCA screen: negative. Alpha 1 Antitrypsin: 231 mg/dL (high). Direct Coombs test: negative. Uric acid: 3 mg/dL (low).

TSH: 2.6 uIU/mL. Fungal immunodiffusion for Aspergillus, Coccidioides, Histoplasma, and Blastomyces: negative. Lung biopsy: Poorly differentiated non-small-cell carcinoma with numerous giant/anaplastic tumor cells. Pulmonary vessels enhance homogeneously bilaterally without evidence for filling defects.

imaging.finding: Poorly differentiated non-small-cell carcinoma with numerous giant/anaplastic tumor cells

customData.content: Biopsy showed aggressive Non-small-cell carcinoma favoring adenocarcinoma. No metastatic disease was seen on imaging. Not a surgical candidate due to severe underlying emphysema. Instructions to follow up urgently with oncology for a PET scan, chemotherapy, and radiation.

data.content: Transition from initial presentation to physical exam and history review. Patient's history of ORIF left tibia with nail placement following a traumatic tibial fracture and social history of daily marijuana use, 1 pack per day smoker for 30 years, no alcohol or drug use, unemployed are noted. Physical exam reveals moderate dactylitis of all fingers and toes, pain to palpation of hands and feet, left knee pain with restricted movement, pain and swelling over left ankle, widespread finger clubbing. Vitals: BP 116/65, T 98.5 degrees Fahrenheit, RR 16, SPO2 100% on room air.

Transition from physical exam to initial workup and treatment. Microcytic anemia is noted (new from 1 year prior). Chest X-ray shows a large oval mass in right upper lobe, may represent bulla or soft tissue mass. Patient is admitted and worked up for arthritis (rheumatoid arthritis, seronegative spondyloarthropathy, disseminated gonococcal infection, or septic arthritis). Started on scheduled NSAIDs and oral glucocorticoids for symptomatic treatment of arthritis.

Transition from initial imaging to follow-up imaging. Chest x-ray revealed a large lung mass. Follow-up CT scan revealed severe emphysema and a 6.5 cm x 8.7 cm x 5.8 cm mass in the right upper lobe. Comprehensive metabolic panel performed.
Transition from imaging to further lab investigations. Urinalysis performed. Acute hepatitis panel: negative. HIV screen: negative. Sedimentation rate: 125 mm/HR (reference 0–15).

Transition from initial labs to further lab investigations. C-reactive protein 261 mg/L (high). Iron profile: Iron 22 mcg/dL (low), TIBC 173 mcg/dL (low), Iron Saturation 13% (low), Ferritin 1330 ng/mL (high). ANA screen: negative. Rheumatoid factor: negative.

Transition from lab results to more specific infectious disease and rheumatologic testing. Anti-CCP antibodies: negative. Gonorrhea and chlamydia PCR: negative. HLA B-27: negative. Parvovirus: IgG positive, IgM negative.
